intro: Weinmannia bradfordii, commonly known as the Bradford's weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Weinmanniaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant features. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
